title: Drawing, "Study for Portrait of a Man", 1860–1900
markings: MB mark within a box on verso.
signed: Wigned with the letters "E" & "I" forming a monogram and ending in a flourish.
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: A bust portrait of a mn in 18th C. attire.  Shown in profile, turned left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study for Portrait of a Man", 1860–1900.
1860–1900. Red chalk on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7029.
